sen.j: 摩阿姫（まあひめ、元亀3年（1572年） -慶長10年10月13日 (旧暦) （1605年11月23日））は、前田利家と芳春院の三女。
sen.e: Princess Mahime (1572- November 23, 1605) was the third daughter born between Toshiie MAEDA and Hoshunin.
Princess Mahime (1572- November 23, 1605) was the third daughter of Toshiie MAEDA and Hoshunin.
sen.cmt: 次列で「芳春院の実子ではないと言われている」とあるので、 the third daughter born between Toshiie MAEDA and Hoshunin →the third daughter of Toshiie MAEDA and Hoshuninとしました。
sen.e: Princess Mahime (1572- November 23, 1605) was the third daughter of Toshiie MAEDA and Hoshunin.

sen.j: 芳春院腹ではなく、側室の子とも言われている。
sen.e: She was not born from Hoshunin, but said to be the child of a concubine.
However, some scholars say that she was not Hoshuin's biological daughter but a child of Toshiie's concubine.

sen.j: 初めは豊臣秀吉の側室になり、後に万里小路充房に嫁ぐ。
sen.e: She first became a concubine of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI before marrying Atsufusa MADENOKOJI.

Her name was Ma (written as 摩阿 or 麻阿 in Japanese).
Her given name was Maa (written as 摩阿 or 麻阿 in Japanese).
sen.cmt: Ma→Maa：表記のご確認をお願いします。
sen.e: Her given name was Maa (written as 摩阿 or 麻阿 in Japanese).

tit.cmt: 以下の説明の内容から、Biography のほうが合っているように思われるのですが、ご検討ください。
チェッカーのコメントを受けて、Biographyとしました。

sen.j: 摩阿は天正10年（1582年）に柴田勝家の家臣、佐久間十蔵と婚約し、北ノ庄城に入る。
sen.e: Ma became engaged to Juzo SAKUMA, who was the vassal of Katsuie SHIBATA, and began to live in Kitanosho-jo Castle in 1582.
Ma became engaged to Juzo SAKUMA, who was the vassal of Katsuie SHIBATA, and began to live in Kitanosho-jo Castle in 1582.

sen.j: ところが、天正11年（1583年）の賤ヶ岳の戦いで、柴田勝家は秀吉に敗れ、十蔵も自害してしまう。
sen.e: However, Katsuie SHIBATA lost against Hideyoshi in the Battle of Shizugatake in 1583 and Juzo also committed suicide.
However, Katsuie SHIBATA was by Hideyoshi in the Battle of Shizugatake in 1583 and Juzo committed suicide.
sen.cmt: 表現を若干変えました。Lost against→was defeated by
sen.e: However, Katsuie SHIBATA was by Hideyoshi in the Battle of Shizugatake in 1583 and Juzo committed suicide.

sen.j: 摩阿は城外に脱出し、前田家に戻った。
sen.e: Ma escaped out of the castle and returned to Maeda family.
Maa escaped out of the castle and returned home to the Maeda family.
sen.cmt: Maeda family→her home, the Maeda family
sen.e: Maa escaped out of the castle and returned home to the Maeda family.

sen.j: 天正13年（1585年）に秀吉の側室になり「加賀殿」と呼ばれるようになる。
sen.e: She became a concubine of Hideyoshi in 1585 and began to be called as 'Kagadono.'
She became a concubine of Hideyoshi in 1585 and began to be called 'Kagadono' (Mrs. Kaga, because of her place of origin).
sen.cmt: 表現を若干変えました。
sen.e: She became a concubine of Hideyoshi in 1585 and began to be called 'Kagadono' (Mrs. Kaga, because of her place of origin).

sen.j: しかし、彼女は体が弱く、実家の前田邸で過ごす事が多かったという。
sen.e: However, her body was weak and often spent her time in her family home of Maeda Palace.
However, she was physically fragile and she often spent her time at home in the residence of the Maeda family.
sen.cmt: her body was weak →she was physically fragile
sen.e: However, she was physically fragile and she often spent her time at home in the residence of the Maeda family.

sen.j: 慶長3年（1598年）の3月に秀吉が催した醍醐の花見に、秀吉の正室や他の側室達と共に出席する。
sen.e: She attended the hanami (cherry blossom viewing party) hosted by Hideyoshi along with his legal wife and other concubines in April 1598.
In April 1598 she took part in a hanami party (cherry blossom viewing party) hosted by Hideyoshi along with his legal wife and other concubines.

sen.e: "I will probably continue to watch the cherry blossom on this mountain of deep snow without losing interest whenever spring comes by."
I never get tired of gazing at the cherry blossom in full bloom, which flourish all at once every spring in the mountain after supporting deep snows.'

sen.j: この後、彼女は病気を理由に、秀吉の側室を辞した。
sen.e: She later retired from being the concubine of Hideyoshi with a reason of her illness.

sen.j: その後は公家の万里小路充房の元に嫁ぐ。
sen.e: She later wed Atsufusa MADENOKOJI, who was a court noble.
She later got married with Atsufusa MADENOKOJI, who was a court noble.

sen.j: 前田利忠を産むが、充房とは離婚した。

sen.j: その後は利忠を連れて金沢に帰り、慶長10年（1605年）の10月13日に死去。
sen.e: She went back to Kanazawa with Toshitada but passed away on November 23, 1605.
She retuned to Kanazawa with her son Toshitada, and she died on November 23, 1605.
